documents.document: @simon_brooke @burnbraeandy Ah. I didn't know that. Seems a short sighted decision.

@simon_brooke In those circumstances (or no-deal) then it might be in Scotland's interest to join EFTA rather than EU - then we could trade with rUK through the EFTA-rUK agreement which I believe has been progressed. I agree tho' that both in EU would be best.

@simon_brooke I see your point. However, if May's deal goes through (and I'm not advocating for it btw, just putting out an idea for a way forward) then there should still be a decent boost for independence, & we won't have to walk through England's ashes to get it. >
@simon_brooke @burnbraeandy The issues of crossing two borders might make a single long ferry journey more attractive.

@iphigenie @gaynordrake @MRennie13 Goodness knows what goes through their minds. I guess it has to do with making sure that at least some supplies are available when there are customs-related delays to imports due to no deal Brexit.
